LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_PawnStatusDesc: Auto-update colonist status daily (join time, relationships, etc.)
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_EventRecordDesc: Extract major events daily from game log (death, marriage, join, construction, etc.)
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_GenerateNowDesc: Generate all enabled knowledge types immediately
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_EnableAtLeastOne: Please enable at least one knowledge generation type
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_AllExist: All colonist status knowledge already exists, no need to generate
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_NoNewEvents: No new major events found, or all events already recorded
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_KeywordsHint: Keywords (separated by commas, leave blank to auto-extract):
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this knowledge?
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_ClearAllConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear all {0} knowledge entries? This action cannot be undone!
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_ImportDesc: Enter or paste knowledge text\nFormat: [Tag]Content\nOne entry per line
LanguageData.RimTalk_Memory_PinMemory: Pin this memory (won't be auto-deleted or decayed)
LanguageData.RimTalk_CanBeExtractedEnabled: Content extraction for lore chain enabled (Click to disable)
LanguageData.RimTalk_CanBeExtractedDisabled: Content extraction for lore chain disabled (Click to enable)
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_ClearConfirm: Clear all knowledge? This cannot be undone!
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_ImportDescription: Paste knowledge text (Format: [Tag]Content, one per line)
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_TagContentEmpty: Tag and content cannot be empty
LanguageData.RimTalk_Knowledge_HelpContent:
„ÄêKnowledge Retrieval Logic„Äë The knowledge library automatically injects relevant knowledge during AI conversations:
1. Keyword Matching: Extracts keywords from conversation context and matches knowledge tags ‚Ä¢ Any Mode: Matches if any keyword is found ‚Ä¢ All Mode: Matches only if all keywords are found ‚Ä¢ ‚ö†Ô∏è Uses substring matching (case-insensitive)
2. Vector Similarity Matching (requires vector service): ‚Ä¢ Uses semantic similarity algorithms to find most relevant knowledge ‚Ä¢ Can find semantically related content even without exact keyword matches
3. Importance Ranking: ‚Ä¢ Matched knowledge is sorted by importance (0.0-1.0) in descending order ‚Ä¢ Only top N most important entries are injected (configurable in settings)
„ÄêHow to Write Effective Knowledge„Äë
‚úì Keep tags clear but avoid too short ‚Ä¢ Good: [Lore-Planet] or [Rules-CombatSystem] (3+ chars) ‚Ä¢ Bad: [War] or [AI] (1-2 chars, prone to false matches) ‚Ä¢ Why: Short tags match too many unrelated contexts
‚úì Use compound tags for precision ‚Ä¢ Good: [Lore-Ringworld] or [Character-John-Background] ‚Ä¢ Bad: [John] (may trigger in unrelated conversations)
‚úì Tags must be triggerable by conversations ‚Ä¢ Problem: Tag [Rules-CombatSystem] won't trigger in "shooting" "melee" conversations ‚Ä¢ Solution: Use [Combat,Shooting,Melee,Dodge] to add trigger keywords ‚Ä¢ Or: [Rules-Combat,Shooting] keeps categorization while adding triggers
‚úì Avoid using skill names as single tags ‚Ä¢ Problem: [Shooting] triggers in ALL conversations of pawns with Shooting skill (‚â•10) ‚Ä¢ Reason: Match text includes pawn's high-level skill names ‚Ä¢ Bad: [Shooting], [Melee], [Construction] (frequent false matches) ‚Ä¢ Good: [Rules-ShootingCombat,Aim], [Tips-Melee,Brawl] (requires explicit mention)
‚úì Make content specific and actionable ‚Ä¢ Good: This planet is a ringworld with 0.8x Earth gravity ‚Ä¢ Bad: This planet is special
‚úì Set appropriate importance levels ‚Ä¢ Core settings/rules: 0.8-1.0 ‚Ä¢ General background: 0.5-0.7 ‚Ä¢ Minor details: 0.3-0.5
‚úì Use extended properties wisely ‚Ä¢ Can Be Matched: Enable to participate in keyword/vector retrieval ‚Ä¢ Can Be Extracted: Enable for knowledge chain referencing
„ÄêCommon Questions„Äë Q: Why is my knowledge injected too frequently? A: Tag might be too short or too broad. Use 3+ character compound tags like [Lore-ColonyHistory] instead of [History]
Q: Why isn't my knowledge being injected? A: Check if knowledge is enabled, matching mode is correct, importance isn't too low, and tags are relevant to conversation
Q: How to make AI use certain knowledge only in specific scenarios? A: Use precise compound tags (e.g., [Rules-Combat-RangedWeapons]) and moderate importance
‚úì Tags must be triggerable by conversations ‚Ä¢ Problem: Tag [Rules-CombatSystem] won't trigger in "shooting" "melee" conversations ‚Ä¢ Solution: Use [Combat,Shooting,Melee,Dodge] to add trigger keywords ‚Ä¢ Or: [Rules-Combat,Shooting] keeps categorization while adding triggers
‚úì Avoid using skill names as single tags ‚Ä¢ Problem: [Shooting] triggers in ALL conversations of pawns with Shooting skill (‚â•10) ‚Ä¢ Reason: Match text includes pawn's high-level skill names ‚Ä¢ Bad: [Shooting], [Melee], [Construction] (frequent false matches) ‚Ä¢ Good: [Rules-ShootingCombat,Aim], [Tips-Melee,Brawl] (requires explicit mention)
‚úì Make content specific and actionable
